resources.string: Walker
True
False
Score 0/13
Wrong!
You got it!
Regular exercise of any kind can improve confidence,energy, weight control and reduce stress.
Walking can reduce the risk of coronary heart disease, strokes, diabetes, high blood pressure and osteoporosis.
Scientific studies have also shown that walking has other benefits besides its physical benefits.
Walking can improve memory skills, learning ability, concentration and abstract reasoning
Sustained walking sessions for a minimum period of 30 minutes a day, five days a week, with the correct walking posture
Walking also improves bone health, especially strengthening the hip bone.
Walking can lower the harmful low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, and raising the useful high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol.
Studies have found that walking may also help prevent dementia and Alzheimers.
Walking can increase the risk of coronary heart disease, strokes, diabetes.
Walking can not improve bone health, especially strengthening the hip bone.
Scientific studies have also shown that walking has no benefits.
Regular exercise of any kind can not improve confidence,energy.
Walking can not lower the harmful low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.
